heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 28 September 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (181°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (232.0°) by approximately 51.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 6.4°C) and outside temperature (down 5.7°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 6%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 546 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 52.7°C), dew point temperature (up 48.6°C), outside temperature (up 52.3°C), and cloud levels (up 359 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 546.2m lower than yesterday, 358.6m lower than the past week, 242.9m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 1094m and a peak of 3930m, averaging 1473.6m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.
cloud levels.summary: Partial cloudiness with some periods of sun.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, dry air conditions likely prevail and near calm conditions. Chance of light rain, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and it’s dark. No significant shifts in the weather are expected.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (2.7°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
